data.title: !TE (PluginManager) (uniflare) Unload plugins in FILO order for dependency.
Msvc with ‘/std:c++latest’: std::shared_ptr::unique() is deprecated in C++17
data.body:
std::shared_ptr::unique() is deprecated in C++17, which is breaking builds by msvc with ‘/std:c++latest’ option on Windows. 
Even I pass  /D_SILENCE_CXX17_SHARED_PTR_UNIQUE_DEPRECATION_WARNING to avoid the warning, but CryEngine need address the issue since it affects all users. 

Errors likes the following, but more files affect.
D:\CryEngine\src\Code\CryEngine\CrySchematyc\Core\Interface\Schematyc/Utils/SharedString.h(62): error C2220: warning treated as error - no 'object' file generated 
D:\CryEngine\src\Code\CryEngine\CrySchematyc\Core\Interface\Schematyc/Utils/SharedString.h(62): warning C4996: 'std::shared_ptr<string>::unique': warning STL4016: std::shared_ptr::unique() is deprecated in C++17. You can define _SILENCE_CXX17_SHARED_PTR_UNIQUE_DEPRECATION_WARNING or _SILENCE_ALL_CXX17_DEPRECATION_WARNINGS to acknowledge that you have received this warning.

data.title: !R (CMake/CryRun) CMakeLists detection additions
data.body:
!B (CMake/CryRun) Fixed corruption due to source-less default project
!T (CMake/CryRun) Always generate CMakeLists (even if no sources present)
!T (CMake/Configure) CE_EXTENSION_NAME overrides solution name
!E uniflare

Added ability to rename generated solution file by setting the cmake variable "CE_EXTENSION_NAME" before including configure.cmake.
Added Auto Detection: Project name / Solution folder (via, ${ProjectName}/CryFileContainer/project/CryEngineModule).
Added Auto Detection: Module Type (no source = hidden project. only .h = CryFileContainer. at least one .cpp = CryEngineModule).
Added Detection: Set CMake variable 'CE_EXTENSION_NAME' before including Configure.cmake to override output solution name.

data.title: !FE (CMake) (uniflare) Added (optional) module type tags.
data.body:
Place one of these tags anywhere in your cmakelists files:
    #MODULETYPE=CONTAINER
    #MODULETYPE=MODULE
    #MODULETYPE=EMPTY

Containers are common/header-only libraries.
Modules are standard dll plugin modules. <- DEFAULT
Empty means ignore this project.

These are not required to use but will remove unwanted builds after generating a fresh solution from your code base.

Using either the tags without this modification - or vice versa, will not cause any conflicts either way.

data.title: !FE (ProjectManager) (uniflare) Allow project file inside asset dir
data.body: By placing the project file inside the assets directory and specifying "." as the [content]=>[assets] value the plugin manager will assume the parent directory as the root, and the current as the assets directory (relative to the project file). (optional).

data.title: (Various) Exit crashes.
data.body:
3 nullptr uses during shutdown phase causes a crash.
Skip if specific pointers are null.

data.title: (MonoRuntime) A Potential startup crash and exit crash.
data.body:
**Symptoms:**
Application crash on startup.

**Immediate Cause:**
`CSystemEventDispatcher::OnSystemEvent` tries to access invalid memory - `CMonoRuntime` - during the `ESYSTEM_PRE_RENDERER_INIT` dispatch.

**Root Cause:**
If `CMonoRuntime::Initialize` fails to find the required Mono Runtime files it deletes itself without cleaning up. Thus registered listeners are deleted without being unregistered cause access violations later on.

**Solution:**
Use the `CMonoRuntime::Shutdown` method to clean up any loose ends that it can before deleting itself.

data.title: Issues when building with MSVC and /permissive-
data.body:
For more context, please see details in https://github.com/CRYTEK/CRYENGINE/issues/177

Issue 1:
We found the following code in CryEngine:

#if CRY_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
    static const bool non_intrusive = std::is_same<decltype(ReflectSchematycType(std::declval<CTypeInfo<TYPE>>())), SGUID>::value;
#else
    static const bool non_intrusive = true; // #SchematycTODO : Fix SFINAE test for non-Windows platforms. Current implementation results in following error in Clang: no matching function for call to 'ReflectSchematycType'.
#endif

When we compile the engine with /permissive-, MSVC gives the same error as clang.
Here is the short explanation on this:
ReflectSchematycType accepts a non-const lvalue reference. The argument 'std::declval<CTypeInfo<TYPE>>()' is an rvalue, though. You can't bind an rvalue to non-const lvalue reference, So it is ill-formed.
When /permissive- isn't used, MSVC has an extension which treats rvalue class as lvalue, so it happens to compile.

Our suggestion is to remove the Microsoft-specific code path and use SFINAE to correctly implement non_intrusive.

data.title: Issues in 3rdparty libraries when building with MSVC and /permissive-
data.body:
Hi,
I’m a developer in Visual C++ compiler team. We are currently doing daily RWC (Read World Code) testing which includes CryEngine.

We are also working with internal partners and the community to fix source issues exposed by /permissive-.
The option isn’t finalized yet (we plan to add some large impact features into it in the incoming VS update), so we don’t suggest community to adopt it yet.
In the meantime, we want to address these source issues as early as possible so that the community can adopt it when it is finalized.

We discover some source issues when we build CryEngine with /permissive-. They are in 3rdparty libraries used by CryEngine, not CryEngine itself.

We reported the issues to these libraries, but some of them appear to be dead (no new releases or activities in recent years).
The libraries are crashrpt, squish-ccr and Oculus SDK. Only the last one is still in active development.

Do you have any suggestions on how we can work together to get these issues resolved? How does CryEngine pick up 3rdparty libraries? Are they updated regularly or stay with the stable version most of the time?

Thanks!

data.title: Flow graph ports bug
data.body: ALLOW_MULTIPLE_PORT_ACTIVATIONS_PER_UPDATE is broken, for example EOP_ONWEAPONCHANGE called twice when connecting to multiplayer, but activation triggers once with first set of data

data.title: .gitignore needs to be updated to account for CMake
data.body: Currently set to only ignore CryWaf's Solutions/* directory.  Needs to have solutions_cmake/* added as well.

data.title: 32 players limit issue  (m_bandwidthBuffer error)
data.body:
We are fighiting with 32 players limit at GameSDK.

MAX_PLAYER_LIMIT - 16 by default. Its easy to change it.

But on the live test - dedicated server just crushed after 32 players. No crash report at logs. 

So we debuged it and found the next bug at Game.cpp (line 2978):
http://take.ms/VJBIb

There is m_bandwidthBuffer if USE_TELEMETRY_BUFFERS defined.
Commented it and now everthing works (~50 players live test done).

Please add fix at the next release (looks like that bugger is not enough for 32+ players).

BTW ENABLE_PROFILING_CODE - is it really required? Is it critical to comment it with USE_TELEMETRY_BUFFERS? It's not enough to disable it at GameSDK (it enabled from the core).

data.title: Fix wrong comparison & removed unnecessary loop
data.body:
LightEntity.h
bActive now compares to m_bActive instead of itself.

CGFLoader.cpp
Removed unnecessary for loop in CompactBoneVertices

data.title: Checking with PVS-Studio static analyser
data.body:
To demonstrate the capabilities of our analyzer, we regularly perform analysis of open source projects. We had recently checked the CryEngine V project.

Here is the link to the article about it: [Critical errors in CryEngine V code](https://www.viva64.com/en/b/0495/)
Official page of the analyzer: http://www.viva64.com/en/pvs-studio/

If you have any questions, or if you are interested in the evaluation of our static analyzer or in any other source code quality control services that our company provides, please contact us at support@viva64.com.

data.title: !TE (CMake) (uniflare) Allow VS to locate CryCommon includes
data.body:
*Should allow visual studio to successfully locate CryCommon includes from following CryCommon and CryAudioCommon source file include directives.

Uses configured VS project user files that include configured VS property sheet files respectively. These sheets simply add the CryCommon disk path to the project' additional include directories.

Visual studio still has some issues with certain includes from certain source files for an unknown reason.
?Expected bug from using VS Property sheets in user files?

data.title: !B (CWE-688) (3DEngine) PVS-Studio: Function Call With Incorrect Variable
data.body:
We have found and fixed a weakness using PVS-Studio tool. PVS-Studio is a static code analyzer for C, C++ and C#: https://www.viva64.com/en/pvs-studio/

Analyzer warning: V549 The first argument of 'memcpy' function is equal to the second argument. ObjectsTree_Serialize.cpp 1135
